other_tests.findings: Wakeful background showed 9–10 Hz alpha rhythm in bilateral occipital regions. Interictal EEG showed generalized 2–2.5 Hz slow spike waves (SSWs) during wakefulness and generalized paroxysmal fast activities (GPFAs) during sleep. Multifocal independent spikes were noted, especially in the bilateral occipital and posterior temporal regions.
Monitoring focused on the temporal, parietal, and occipital regions, especially on the left side, but without lateralization or localization.
Initially considered negative at another hospital; however, at the current hospital, MRI showed a suspiciously unclear gray-white matter boundary around the left calcarine sulcus.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Detection of suspicious findings in the current hospital after initial negative results.

other_tests.findings: Showed low metabolism in the same area as the MRI finding.
